slides.title: Welcome to Policy Tools
slides.notes: Introduction to Policy Tools in PolicyCenter.
slides.narration: Welcome to our exploration of Policy Tools in Guidewire PolicyCenter. This lesson will delve into the suite of tools available to manage and analyze policy files effectively. As a PolicyCenter developer, understanding these tools is crucial for customizing and optimizing policy management workflows. We're setting the stage for a deeper dive into how these tools interact with the PolicyCenter data model and user interface.

slides.title: Overview of Policy Tools
slides.notes: An overview of the functionalities provided by Policy Tools.
slides.narration: Policy Tools in PolicyCenter offers a comprehensive suite for accessing key policy file details. From viewing policy summaries to managing financial transactions, these tools are designed to streamline policy management. As we go through each tool, consider how they integrate with PolicyCenter's core entities and processes, enhancing both user experience and data accuracy.

slides.title: Key Functional Areas
slides.notes: Highlight the key areas covered by Policy Tools.
slides.narration: The key functional areas within Policy Tools include policy summaries, billing information, contact management, and risk analysis, among others. Each of these areas interacts with specific entities and data relationships within PolicyCenter. As we explore these functionalities, think about how you can leverage these tools to improve policy handling and decision-making processes in your implementations.

slides.title: Detailed Look at Policy Tools
slides.originalNotes:
Policy tools
The Policy Tools provides access to many Policy File details.

Summary provides concise information about the entire Policy File. The screen includes information about current activities, completed andpending policy transactions.
Billing allows you to view the overall balance orbalances for individual policy periods.
Contacts screen lists all of the contacts associated with a policy. For each contact, you can view basic contact information and the role the contact plays on the policy.
Participants screen lists the users interacting withthe policy by the role thatthey perform on the policy. In addition, the assigned group that the user belongs to is shown . You can add, remove, or change participants.
Policy transaction displays summary information about all policy transactions that have occurred on the policy. This list includes jobs that have modified the policy, as well as jobs that are in-progress, withdrawn, not taken or non-renewed. 
Notes screen allows you to search and review notes related to the policy transaction or policy.
Documents screen allows you to search and view any attached documents related to the policy transaction or policy.
Risk Analysis displays issues that may affect the policy. Underwriting issues, which are notesabout an issue relevant to the creation or renewal of a policy, may cause the carrier to deny the policy or raise the premium- It also displays claims, prior policies, prior losses, or contingencies.
Reinsurance is insurance risk transferred to another insurance company for all or part of an assumed liability.
History allows you to search and view historical events pertaining to the policy.
Financial Transactions screen is an internal tool used for rating while developing the application. Users with the internaltools permission
     can access this screen.

For example, the Contacts screen displays associated entities and their roles, crucial for maintaining accurate party relationships. The Risk Analysis section is particularly important for underwriting, as it flags issues that could impact policy decisions. Understanding how these tools map to PolicyCenter's data model entities such as 'Policy', 'Contact', and 'Activity' can guide your customization efforts.

This integration ensures seamless financial operations and accurate record-keeping, which are pivotal for policy management and customer satisfaction.

slides.title: Contacts and Participants
slides.notes: Understanding the role of Contacts and Participants in policy management.
slides.narration: Managing Contacts and Participants is integral to maintaining accurate policy records. The Contacts section outlines the roles and relationships of entities involved with the policy. Meanwhile, Participants highlight the users and groups interacting with the policy, offering insights into role-based access and permissions. These components are vital for ensuring data integrity and security within PolicyCenter.

slides.title: Policy Transactions Overview
slides.notes: Explore the summary information about all policy transactions.
slides.narration: The Policy Transactions section provides a summary of all activities that have modified the policy, including jobs that are in-progress, withdrawn, or completed. This area is crucial for tracking policy lifecycle changes and understanding how each transaction impacts the overall policy status. As a developer, consider how transaction data can be leveraged for reporting and analytics purposes.

slides.title: Risk Analysis and Reinsurance
slides.notes: Delve into Risk Analysis and Reinsurance functionalities.
slides.narration: Risk Analysis and Reinsurance tools are pivotal for assessing policy risks and managing liability. Risk Analysis identifies underwriting issues and historical claims that could affect policy renewals or premiums. Reinsurance, on the other hand, allows for the transfer of insurance risk, offering additional layers of financial protection. Both these tools are essential for comprehensive risk management and strategic decision-making.

slides.notes: Historical events and notes provide insights into policy history.
slides.narration: The History and Notes sections offer critical insights into past policy events and communications. This historical context aids in making informed decisions about future policy actions and adjustments, emphasizing the importance of detailed record-keeping in PolicyCenter.

slides.notes: Discuss best practices for customizing Policy Tools.
slides.narration: Customizing Policy Tools requires a solid understanding of Guidewire's data model and configuration points. These practices help maintain system integrity and ensure long-term sustainability and ease of upgrades.
